format.bulkUpload:
MITOCHONDRIAL en: Mutation nomenclatures:
Inserts: 239.1C
Substitution or nucleotide change: A73G
Deletions: A249DEL
format.baseFrequency:
Header example:
allele,TH01,D21S11
Example row:
4,0.00006,
Separate with comma. Do not use 0.
An fmin that will be used in calculations can be specified:
fmin,0.00006,0.00005

general.save: Save changes made to the 4 sections
general.add: Add the rule to be effectively saved

alias.general: Setup of the aliases belonging to this category. These aliases are those used in the ''Specimen Category'' column of the GeneMapper® file in the bulk import

matching.general: The rules specify what type of profiles are searched for matches, the minimum level of stringency, the algorithm,  the minimum number of loci that it must have in common and the maximum number of mismatches accepted

analyses.maxOverageDeviatedLoci: Number of loci with excessive allelic values
analyses.maxAllelesPerLocus: Maximum number of alleles in a locus. Limit contributors.
analyses.general: Setup for the validity and quality of profiles according to the category to which they belong
analyses.minLocusPerProfile: Number of loci that must have allelic values. It can be specified according to K (representative parameter of the kit)
analyses.filiationDataRequired: Shows that the category enables personal data of the person to with the profile belongs
analyses.allowManualLoading: Show that the category allows manual upload of profiles belonging to that category
analyses.pedigreeAssociation: Shows that the association in a pedigree is allowed
analyses.mixture: Shows that the category is evidence from more than one contributor
analyses.replicate: Show that these profiles are sent to superior instances

associations.general: The association rules specify the category to which the profiles that can be associated with the profiles whose category is being edited belong. Profiles whose category has association rules will not participate in the match search until they are associated to a profile that complies with the association rules
